titles.title: Permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony in honor of the Fiftieth Anniversary of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) and welcoming the three newest members of NATO, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Hungary, and the Czech Republic, into NATO.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mr. Thomas asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 4/12/1999--Introduced. Authorizes the use of the U.S. Capitol rotunda on April 23, 1999, for a ceremony honoring the 50th Anniversary of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) and welcoming into NATO the three newest members: the Republic of Poland; the Republic of Hungary; and the Czech Republic.
